extends Object
    Utility methods for collections.

      • reverse

        public static <K,V> LinkedHashMap<K,V> reverse(Map<K,V> in)
        Reverses the order of a LinkedHashMap.
        Parameters:
        in - The map to reverse the order on.
        Returns:
        A new LinkedHashMap with keys in reverse order.

      • addIfNotNull

        public static <T> List<T> addIfNotNull(List<T> l,
                                       T o)
        Add a value to a list if the value is not null.
        Parameters:
        l - The list to add to.
        o - The element to add.
        Returns:
        The same list.

      • addReverse

        public static List<?> addReverse(List list,
                                 List append)
        Adds the contents of one list to the other in reverse order.

        i.e. add values from 2nd list from end-to-start order to the end of the 1st list.

        Parameters:
        list - The list to append to.
        append - Contains the values to append to the list.
        Returns:
        The same list.

      • addReverse

        public static List<?> addReverse(List list,
                                 Object[] append)
        Adds the contents of the array to the list in reverse order.

        i.e. add values from the array from end-to-start order to the end of the list.

        Parameters:
        list - The list to append to.
        append - Contains the values to append to the list.
        Returns:
        The same list.

      • reverseIterable

        public static <T> Iterable<T> reverseIterable(Collection<T> c)
        Returns a reverse iterable of the specified collection.
        Parameters:
        c - The collection to iterate over.
        Returns:
        An iterable over the collection in reverse order.

      • reverse

        public static <T> List<T> reverse(List<T> l)
        Same as Collections.reverse(List), but returns the list.
        Parameters:
        l - The list being reversed
        Returns:
        The same list.

      • reverseCopy

        public static <T> List<T> reverseCopy(List<T> l)
        Creates a new copy of a list in reverse order.
        Parameters:
        l - The old list.
        Returns:
        A new list with reversed entries.
        Returns null if the list was null.
        Returns the same list if the list is empty.

      • collapse

        public static List<Object> collapse(Object... o)
        Collapses a collection of individual objects, arrays, and collections into a single list of objects.
        Parameters:
        o - The collection of objects to collapse.
        Returns:
        A new linked-list of objects.

      • collapse

        public static List<Object> collapse(List<Object> l,
                                    Object... o)
        Same as collapse(Object...) but allows you to supply your own list to append to.
        Parameters:
        l - The list to append to.
        o - The collection of objects to collapse.
        Returns:
        The same list passed in.

      • immutableList

        public static <T> List<T> immutableList(Collection<T> l)
        Creates an immutable list from the specified collection.
        Parameters:
        l - The collection to copy from.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable ArrayList copy of the collection, or a Collections.emptyList() if the collection was empty or null.

      • unmodifiableList

        public static <T> List<T> unmodifiableList(List<T> l)
        Creates an unmodifiable list from the specified collection.
        Parameters:
        l - The collection to copy from.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable view of the list, or a Collections.emptyList() if the list was empty or null.

      • immutableList

        public static <T> List<T> immutableList(T[] l)
        Creates an immutable list from the specified array.
        Parameters:
        l - The array to copy from.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable ArrayList copy of the collection, or a Collections.emptyList() if the collection was empty or null.

      • immutableMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> immutableMap(Map<K,V> m)
        Creates an immutable map from the specified map.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to copy from.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable LinkedHashMap copy of the collection, or a Collections.emptyMap() if the collection was empty or null.

      • unmodifiableMap

        public static <K,V> Map<K,V> unmodifiableMap(Map<K,V> m)
        Creates an unmodifiable map from the specified map.
        Parameters:
        m - The map to copy from.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable view of the collection, or a Collections.emptyMap() if the collection was empty or null.

      • assertTypes

        public static void assertTypes(List<Object> l,
                               Class<?>... c)
        Asserts that all entries in the list are either instances or subclasses of at least one of the specified classes.
        Parameters:
        l - The list to check.
        c - The valid classes.
